outcome.title: Simplify Arithmetic Expressions
outcome.description: I can evaluate and simplify arithmetic expressions without the use of a calculator, using order of operations and properties of the real numbers. [1.1]

outcome.title: Evaluate Formulas
outcome.description: I can evaluate a formula for a given input value, and use formulas to solve real-world problems. [1.1]

outcome.title: Exponent and Root Properties
outcome.description: I can use exponent laws to simplify expressions involving exponents, and to convert between radicals and rational exponents. [1.2]

outcome.title: Polynomial Algebra and Factoring
outcome.description: I can identify, characterize, and add/subtract/multiply polynomial expressions, simplify the result, and factor polynomials using a variety of techniques. [1.4]

outcome.title: Exponential, Log, and Radical Expressions
outcome.description: I can convert between logarithmic, exponential, and radical expressions. I can evaluate simple exponential and logarithmic expressions without using a calculator. [1.3]

outcome.title: Linear Equations and Inequalities
outcome.description: I can solve linear equations and inequalities in one variable, and express these answers graphically and using interval notation. [2.2, 2.7]

outcome.title: Absolute Value Equations and Inequalities
outcome.description: I can solve linear equations and inequalities involving absolute values, and express these answers graphically and using interval notation. [2.7, 3.6]

outcome.title: Forms of Linear Equations
outcome.description: I can express linear equations using point-slope, slope-intercept, and standard form. I can determine an equation for a line through two given points, and a line through one given point with a given slope. [2.2]

outcome.title: Quadratic Equations
outcome.description: I can solve quadratic equations using factoring, completing the square, and the quadratic formula. [2.5]

outcome.title: Sign Charts
outcome.description: I can create a complete sign chart for a quadratic or rational inequality. [IA 7.6]

outcome.title: Exponential and Logarithmic Equations
outcome.description: I can solve basic exponential equations and basic logarithmic equations. [6.5, 6.6]

outcome.title: Definition of Function
outcome.description: I can use the definition of function to distinguish whether a given relation, equation, or graph defines a function. [3.1]

outcome.title: Using Function Notation
outcome.description: I can use function notation appropriately, and evaluate a function for a given input value. [2.1]

outcome.title: Basic Function Graphing
outcome.description: I can graph a function by plotting ordered pairs. I can quickly and accurately graph a library of “basic” functions. [2.1]

outcome.title: Slope and Average Rate of Change
outcome.description: I can determine the slope between two given points, and the average rate of change of a given function over a given interval. [2.1, 3.3]

outcome.title: Reading a Function's Graph
outcome.description: I can use a function’s graph to obtain information about a function, including its domain and range, intercepts, maximum and minimum points, and whether it is increasing or decreasing. [2.1, 3.3]

outcome.title: Domain and Intercepts of a Function
outcome.description: I can use a function’s formula to determine its domain and its x- and y-intercepts. [3.1, 3.2]

outcome.title: Transforming Functions
outcome.description: I can apply transformations including horizontal and vertical shifts, stretches, and reflections to a function. I can express the result of these transformations graphically and algebraically. [3.5]

outcome.title: Composite Functions
outcome.description: I can simplify composite functions, and evaluate them algebraically and graphically. [3.4]

outcome.title: Inverse Functions
outcome.description: I can determine if a function is one-to-one, and compare, contrast, and convert between a function and its inverse function both algebraically and graphically. [3.7]

outcome.title: Linear Models and Meanings
outcome.description: I can build linear models from verbal descriptions, and use the models to establish conclusions, including by contextualizing the meaning of slope and intercept parameters. [2.3, 4.2]

outcome.title: Parallel and Perpendicular
outcome.description: I can use slope relationships to determine whether two lines are parallel or perpendicular. [2.2]

outcome.title: Systems of Two Linear Equations
outcome.description: I can solve a system of two linear equations using either a substitution or an elimination method. [7.1]

outcome.title: Graphing Quadratic Functions
outcome.description: I can graph quadratic functions using transformations of f(x)=x^2, and identify their axis of symmetry and maximum or minimum point. [5.1]

outcome.title: Quadratic Models and Meanings
outcome.description: I can build quadratic models from verbal descriptions, and use the models to establish conclusions. [5.1]

outcome.title: Properties of Polynomial Functions
outcome.description: I can use the graph of a polynomial function to determine some of its properties, including the parity of its degree, the sign of its leading coefficient, its zeroes and their multiplicity. [1.4,5.2,5.3]

outcome.title: Properties of Rational Functions
outcome.description: I can use its formula to find the domain, vertical and horizontal asymptotes, and intercepts of a given rational function. I can use this information along with a sign chart to sketch the graph of a given rational function. [5.6]

outcome.title: Exponential Functions
outcome.description: I can identify the base and intercept of a given exponential function, evaluate exponential functions, and determine an equation for an exponential function given two data points. [6.1]

outcome.title: Graphs of Exponential Functions
outcome.description: I can graph exponential functions and determine algebraically and graphically whether an exponential function represents growth or decay. [7.2]

outcome.title: Logarithmic Functions
outcome.description: I can determine an equation for a logarithmic function, its base, and domain, and its graph. [6.3-6.4]

outcome.title: Change of Base
outcome.description: I can apply the change of base formula to a logarithmic function. [6.3-6.4]
